## 사건 정보

**사건명**: The People of the State of New York v. Taheen Hayes
**판결일**: 2008-02-26
**법원**: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of the State of New York
**관할**: New York, NY

## 인용

- 48 A.D.3d 831
- 851 N.Y.S.2d 365

## 판결문 요약


Appeal by the defendant from a judgment of the Supreme Court, Kings County (Dowling, J.), rendered July 7, 2005, convicting him of manslaughter in the first degree, upon a jury verdict, and imposing sentence.
Ordered that the judgment is affirmed.
The defendant’s contention that improprieties in the trial court’s supplemental jury instructions and the prosecutor’s summation combined to deprive him of a fair trial is unpreserved for appellate review. The defendant failed to object with specificity to the challenged summation remarks and did not move for a mistrial on this ground (see CPL 470.05 [2]; People v Tonge, 93 NY2d 838 [1999]; People v Tevaha, 84 NY2d 879 [1994]; People v Evans, 291 AD2d 569 [2002]; People v Livigni, 288 AD2d 323 [2001]). The trial court’s response to a jury note seeking supplemental instructions regarding the defendant’s statements to the police was meaningful and did not result in any prejudice to the defendant (see CPL 310.30; People v Santi, 3 NY3d 234, 248 [2004]; People v Almodovar, 62 NY2d 126, 131 [1984]; People v Malloy, 55 NY2d 296, 302 [1982], cert denied 459 US 847 [1982]; People v Arcarola, 96 AD2d 1081 [1983]).
